title: How did this cause me to get a leaverbuster?
body:
I come back after not playing for 14 days and queue up for a ranked game, I play 25+ minutes of the game before the league game crashes and forces itself to repair. https://gyazo.com/1e9b6c0105250b06e89761da58b17899 seen here.
After league finishes repairing it throws me back into the game and I play the game out and end up winning. 
This whole process took no more than 5 minutes outside of game to complete.
How am I given a leaverbuster for this? It was completely out of my control there was absolutely nothing I could do to prevent this, the game did not detect and issue with the client when I opened it so why am I being punished for league being at fault?

Leaver buster warning right after the game is complete: https://gyazo.com/1e9b6c0105250b06e89761da58b17899

I wan't to know why I was given this leaver buster and if there is any way I can get it revoked because this is not my fault at all.

replies.body:
Game crashes that cause the client to repatch are pretty hard to catch prior to the game starting. They crash like that because they finally pull on a file that ends up being corrupted or missing, which then causes the crash. The client realizes that the crash happened due to missing/damaged files, so it starts a repatch. 

You ended up with the LPQ because you were out of the match for long enough to have it affect the overall game most likely, regardless of whether you made it back in or not.
